original: ci ltar zhe na gzhan mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brjod pa dang de bzhin gshegs pas bdag tu gsungs pa de gang zag gi bdag med par rnam par 'jog go //

translated: How so? The self that is described by the non-Buddhists and the self that is taught by the Tathagata are both posited as the selflessness of persons.

original: bdag tu lta ba de yang lta ba ma mchis par gsungs pa ni chos kyi bdag med par 'jog ste /

translated: The statement that the view of a self is said to be nonview is posited as the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gal te bdag tu lta ba de la lta bar 'dzin pa med pa de ltar sbyor bar byed na rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu lta ba de la lta bar 'dzin pa med pa de ltar sbyor bar byed na rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If one practices by not grasping at the view of a self as a view, one will enter into yoga.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa de ni der 'jug pa'i thabs yin no //
